text: Does anyone have a responsive navigation they like that doesn’t break the advanced menus? The ones I like seem to all be abandoned or have some key flaw.
what exactly do you mean break the menus, and what have you tried?
I have a menu that is pretty decent. I had to roll it myself. I only have it set up to do two levels but if you wanted more levels it is all in the CSS
I used it here <@U7BEP5R7T> <https://www.creditcanada.com/>
I just meant that they require you to do the entire navigation in pure HTML as opposed to using the HUBL menu modules
Don’t have an ipad nearby, but how do you handle trying to access the dropdowns on a touch device?
This is the one I had been using - <https://github.com/ComputerWolf/SlickNav>
On ipads there isn’t a way (with this one) to expand the drop-downs
Honestly i think there might need to be some css updates to this repo but the js is solid.. <https://bitbucket.org/snippets/bluleadz/BBEodd>
i've used <https://www.smartmenus.org/> but it required alot of JS to remove a majority of the default HS classes
I use sidr.js (<https://www.berriart.com/sidr/>)
I also just recently used <https://github.com/mango/slideout#installation>
usually they take some customizing for dropdowns
Why remove them. if you take them out of their environment the HubSpot styles dont function anymore and you dont have to override anything.
the hs classes were conflicting with it for some reason, i cant remember why.
<@U38EZFVFE> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U38EZFVFE/F7CRB9MAR/-.js|Untitled>
this is all the script needed to setup my mobile nav
it clones the menu parent ul and places it in a destination of my choice’
Thats how I do my menu insert with mobile menus, but I was thinking i'm going to move it to a non JS move and have it loaded on the server side.... maybe quicken my mobile load time up
You could store them in localstorage per session. but that is kinda hardcore
But you guys hand code all of your templates right?
mostly. like when we HS migrates a site, sometimes it is diffuclt when we redesign the home page and have to move the header/footer to the rest of the pages
so some of them are in the drag/drop
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7C6DBRU1/pasted_image_at_2017_10_03_12_49_pm.png|curerntly workign on this>
so when we migrate over, we have to overried a bunch of the already created HubSpot styles
when they style the .header-container and such (which i'm pretty sure was advised against when teh cos came out)
So you’re just using jquery to find where you need to add additional classes. Interesting. That doesn’t cause a flash of unstyled menu? I’d be concerned about nailing the load order correctly.
it didnt for me.
i prefer to do it myself
migrating over sites?
yeah.
i never migrate with HubSpot just make my own design from scratch to avoid conflict with native css
i always create my own template on the COS
